text:
A Tom and Jerry fan!

According to your information, the dog\'s name in Tom and Jerry is actually "Spike", not "Killer". "Killer" is not a confirmed name for the dog in the Tom and Jerry cartoons. However, "Spike" is a well-known character in the series, and you've provided some interesting details about his appearances and voice actor, Daws Butler.

evidences.text: He is named "Killer", and in "The Truce Hurts" he signs his name "Butch" on the treaty peace paper.
evidences.summary: The dog is referred to as "Killer" and "Butch" in specific episodes.

evidences.text: He is also a Devil Dog in "Heavenly Puss".
evidences.summary: Spike is depicted as a "Devil Dog" in the episode "Heavenly Puss".

evidences.text: In 1949's "Love That Pup", Spike was given a puppy son, Tyke, who became another popular supporting character.
evidences.summary: Spike's son, Tyke, is introduced in the 1949 episode "Love That Pup".

evidences.text: His voice was taken over by Daws Butler, who styled Spike's voice after Jimmy Durante.
evidences.summary: Daws Butler provided Spike's voice, inspired by Jimmy Durante.

evidences.text: When Spike sees the truth, he lets out a roar like a buffalo roar and leaps into the air for the sake of revenge.
evidences.summary: Spike reacts aggressively with a roar and leaps for revenge.

evidences.text: Tom panics and tunnels into the ground in an attempt to escape, but Spike digs him up with his large jaws.
evidences.summary: Spike uses his strength to dig up Tom during the chase.

evidences.text: The chase wakes up all the other dogs, who join the chase.
evidences.summary: Spike's chase with Tom incites other dogs to join in.
